title: How to Expand Heat Shrink Tubing

steps.title: Select the right tool for the size of the heat shrink tubing you want to expand.
steps.content: Select the right tool for the size of the heat shrink tubing you want to expand. Most smaller tubing is easy to stretch with needle-nose pliers. If possible, find a pair with extended ends to accommodate longer sections of tubing. [2] X Research source

steps.title: To stretch larger tubing, use a combination of two pliers to expand the tubing as shown in this illustration.
steps.content: To stretch larger tubing, use a combination of two pliers to expand the tubing as shown in this illustration. Extremely small tubing calls for tweezers with needlepoint tips, such as LTD's Tweezerman models.

steps.title: Insert the tweezers or pliers into the tubing as far as possible.
steps.content: Insert the tweezers or pliers into the tubing as far as possible. Make sure the tool used is completely closed.

steps.title: Pull the pliers apart slowly to open up the ends.
steps.content: Pull the pliers apart slowly to open up the ends. If using tweezers, use a jeweler's screwdriver to help pry the tweezers apart.

steps.title: Stretch the tubing only a little at a time to avoid tearing or puncturing it.
steps.content: Stretch the tubing only a little at a time to avoid tearing or puncturing it.

steps.title: Close the tweezers or pliers and rotate the tubing slightly.
steps.content: Close the tweezers or pliers and rotate the tubing slightly.

steps.title: Repeat steps 2 through 5 until you have rotated the tubing enough to return to your starting point.
steps.content: Repeat steps 2 through 5 until you have rotated the tubing enough to return to your starting point. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Flip the tubing to so that the other end of it fits over the tweezers or pliers, and repeat the above steps.
steps.content: Flip the tubing to so that the other end of it fits over the tweezers or pliers, and repeat the above steps.

steps.title: The tubing is now ready for use.
steps.content: The tubing is now ready for use.
